item.title: Game, Set, Fans: 10 Sports Marketing Trends for 2012
item.description: Based on the best practices as observed in 2011, the following is a list of 10 sports marketing trends that are potentially to continue growing in 2012. Just like last year, while some trends are already knocking on the door of the mainstream, others are yet to be discovered by most of the sports brands. All trends are carefully selected to reflect the most important changes in the industry in terms of fan experience, engagement, loyalty and eventually new revenue sources. In 2011, we witnessed some very exciting and innovative campaigns that had an impact. Some new trendsetting sports brands emerged. Manchester City seems to be be gaining the edge in the digital communication as it earned four mentions in this trend report.
item.content:encoded: Based on the best practices as observed in 2011, the following is a list of 10 sports marketing trends that are potentially to continue growing in 2012. Just like last year, while some trends are already knocking on the door of the mainstream, others are yet to be discovered by most of the sports brands. All trends are carefully selected to reflect the most important changes in the industry in terms of fan experience, engagement, loyalty and eventually new revenue sources. In 2011, we witnessed some very exciting and innovative campaigns that had an impact. Some new trendsetting sports brands emerged. Manchester City seems to be be gaining the edge in the digital communication as it earned four mentions in this trend report.
item.author: tomjanca@slideshare.net(tomjanca)

media:content.media:title: Game, Set, Fans: 10 Sports Marketing Trends for 2012
media:content.media:description:
Based on the best practices as observed in 2011, the following is a list of 10 sports marketing trends that are potentially to continue growing in 2012.
Just like last year, while some trends are already knocking on the door of the mainstream, others are yet to be discovered by most of the sports brands.
All trends are carefully selected to reflect the most important changes in the industry in terms of fan experience, engagement, loyalty and eventually new revenue sources.
In 2011, we witnessed some very exciting and innovative campaigns that had an impact. Some new trendsetting sports brands emerged. Manchester City seems to be be gaining the edge in the digital communication as it earned four mentions in this trend report.

Just like last year, while some trends are already knocking on the door of the mainstream, others are yet to be discovered by most of the sports brands. All trends are carefully selected to reflect the most important changes in the industry in terms of fan experience, engagement, loyalty and eventually new revenue sources. In 2011, we witnessed some very exciting and innovative campaigns that had an impact. Some new trendsetting sports brands emerged. Manchester City seems to be be gaining the edge in the digital communication as it earned four mentions in this trend report.

item.title: What Makes ME Creative?
item.description: Ogilvy’s Associates program asks its applicants in a creative exercise to answer "what makes you creative?" Here’s my answer. Opted for the PowerPoint format since in the corporate setting, we’re about presenting and conveying information through images. But we cannot be boring. Not only do I want to show that I can be in the setting to present my ideas to team members and clients, but that I want to go the route that others may not have chosen as their "creative option." In addition, taking a look at the colour palette, you’ll be quick to notice that I’ve picked up some colours from the Ogilvy Associates page - the deep red and light grays (that are almost white). I think about complementing in terms of call (you) and response (me).
item.content:encoded: Ogilvy’s Associates program asks its applicants in a creative exercise to answer "what makes you creative?" Here’s my answer. Opted for the PowerPoint format since in the corporate setting, we’re about presenting and conveying information through images. But we cannot be boring. Not only do I want to show that I can be in the setting to present my ideas to team members and clients, but that I want to go the route that others may not have chosen as their "creative option." In addition, taking a look at the colour palette, you’ll be quick to notice that I’ve picked up some colours from the Ogilvy Associates page - the deep red and light grays (that are almost white). I think about complementing in terms of call (you) and response (me).

Ogilvy's Associates program asks its applicants in a creative exercise to answer "what makes you creative?" Here's my answer.
Opted for the PowerPoint format since in the corporate setting, we're about presenting and conveying information through images. But we cannot be boring. Not only do I want to show that I can be in the setting to present my ideas to team members and clients, but that I want to go the route that others may not have chosen as their "creative option."
In addition, taking a look at the colour palette, you'll be quick to notice that I've picked up some colours from the Ogilvy Associates page - the deep red and light grays (that are almost white). I think about complementing in terms of call (you) and response (me).

item.title: The Dark Side of Social Media 2012
item.description: The Dark Side of Social Media 2012 is a trendreport that @duivestein and @BLO2M have written. This presentation accompanies the report. The Dutch version of the report can be downloaded here: http://bit.ly/AoRnCo An English version of the report will be available at the end of February 2012. Please follow us at http://www.twitter.com/duivestein and http://www.twitter.com/blo2m to get updates about our report. Aslo stay tuned for our book The App Effect, http://www.theappeffect.org

item.title: Do The IMPOSSIBLE
item.description: This is a project I did for Joel Runyon of ImpossibleHQ.com. I’ve known Joel for almost 2 years now and think he is doing some really cool stuff. I was happy to work with him when he approached me with this project and am excited to see how it inspires people to do the impossible... because something is only impossible until it’s been done.
